message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with the problem of label noise in training convolutional neural networks, which is a common issue in machine learning. The proposed approach involves unsupervised modeling of label noise and loss correction, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The experiments are conducted on image datasets, which suggests computer vision (cs.CV) as another likely sub-category. The approach also involves mixup augmentation, which is a popular data augmentation technique in deep learning and falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of beta mixture model and bootstrapping loss correction also suggests neural networks (cs.NE) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as bootstrapping, which suggests computational linguistics (cs.CL) as another possible sub-category.
